ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: If you return,   Israel —

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńtyé á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ, ńgwɔ́ nénʉ́, ńkʉa;
en: then you can swear, “As the  Lord  lives,”

ngiemboon: Ammó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn
en: For this is what the Lord says to the men of Judah and Jerusalem:

ngiemboon: Pi sɔg ntʉ́m gẅí,
en: Circumcise yourselves to the  Lord;

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pà Yúndà,
en: Declare in Judah, proclaim in Jerusalem, and say,

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa shÿó Siyoŋ, ńtÿɔ́gɔ liŋé.
en: Lift up a signal flag toward Zion.

ngiemboon: Púʼntʉ̀ fǒ lelyěen yé ńkẅɛ,
en: A lion has gone up from his thicket;

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, pi tʉ́me pɔ̀ɔn zẅɛ̌ʼ pi,
en: Because of this, put on sackcloth;

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: “On that day” #— #this is the Lord’s declaration #— #“the king and the officials will lose their courage. The priests will tremble in fear, and the prophets will be scared speechless.”

ngiemboon: Tà ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: I said, “Oh no, Lord God, you have certainly deceived   this people and Jerusalem, by announcing, ‘You will have peace,’  # 4:10 Jr 6:14; 23:17 while a sword is at  # 4:10 Lit sword touches our throats.”

ngiemboon: Á ge láʼ gwɔ́ fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn
en: “At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem, ‘A searing wind   blows from the barren heights in the wilderness on the way to my dear  # 4:11 Lit to the daughter of my people. It comes not to winnow or to sift;

ngiemboon: Aa fèfà gẅie à gẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g,
